Posts.Content: Hi,  I've been for a fitting at John Lewis today the lady was so helpful.  They was recommended by one of the nurse's and they also take the VAT off the price if you have been treated for cancer. Take care Karen
Posts.Title: Bras again!

Posts.Content: Hi Pookie33 Just wanted to say good luck for tomorrow.  Im sure we all think we are coming to the end once diagnosed I sure did,  I was out there making my will, making plans for the kids who thankfully are older, even putting emergency money into their bank accounts and 2 years later im still here. We had a holiday booked to florida for my 50th Birthday celebration s instead the holiday had to be cancelled and I was having a pick-line fitted on the actual day for chemo the following day.  You will worry at every stage but you will get through. All the best Karen
Posts.Title: Awaiting breast biopsy results

Posts.Content: Hi Good luck for tomorrow to everyone getting results Take care Karen
Posts.Title: Awaiting breast biopsy results

Posts.Content: Hi Gem I was diagnosed in Jan 2015 with invasive DCIS with lymp nodes involved and was really scared at the time but like everyone on here is saying this is a great site with personal experiences that help us along the way.  I had a mastectomy with  expander then chemo and radiotherapy am now taking Tamoxifen.  My expander will be replaced in November with an implant. The waiting for results and appointments was really hard but once your team looking after you have them a plan of treament is then discussed and I felt much better and thought iv got do whatever I have to.  Im feeling really good and have overcome my fear of hospitals now.  Hope you get your treatment plan soon and keep us updated. Take care Karen
Posts.Title: I have just been diagnosed with invasive ductual carcinoma stage 2...

Posts.Content: Hi I just wanted to add I picked up some bra's that I had ordered on line yesterday from George/Asda a couple of pretty lacey ones and bargains at £6 and £8 and so comfortable.  Have a look on line they have a mastectomy range. Take care all Karen
Posts.Title: Bras - rant!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi pleased to hear it's just old age and certainly gives hope to hear your story, thank you. Karen
Posts.Title: Weight gain with Tamixifen

Posts.Content: Hi squajygirl Just wanted to say its so inspiring to hear from people diagnosed so long ago and I can imagine treatment was so different.  I would go to your doctor and get checked out. Take care Karen
Posts.Title: Weight gain with Tamixifen

Posts.Content: Hi Poohbear44 I started Tamoxifen last December and I have put on 2 stone but carn't be sure its totally the tamoxifen as I do enjoy all the cakes/sweets (-:   After xmas I'm going to try and cut all the junk out so will hopefully have a better idea. I also have found the brand TEVA has suited me much better so keep a check on what is best for you.  I no longer have the knee/joint pain and the hot flushes are less frequent. Hair is still short but now growing a lot thicker rather than longer but I actually like it my chemo finished September 2015. Good luck with the tamoxifen it has to be worth trying. Take care Karen
Posts.Title: Weight gain with Tamixifen

Posts.Content: So true, thanks for sharing  Take care Karen
Posts.Title: Shoes

Posts.Content: Hi, yes I still have nose sores I finished chemo September 2015 so don’t think thats the cause.  A friend also gets them but she finished chemo around the same time, however she does think it’s due to the menopause as everything dries out and that’s does sound about right.  Karen
Posts.Title: Nose sores!!

Posts.Content: Happy New Year all Hi Croxley I had my expander implant replaced in November and have been offered for the other breast to be reduced and uplifted, all along I have said to my surgeon and family `why mess with it if it's not essential' but I am coming around to the idea of having it done.  I see a difference when dressed in photos etc although the family disagrees its obvious unless you look for it.  I think we have to go with how we feel so I see my surgeon in February and thinking to go ahead with the reduction.  Im finally going back to work this month after 21month's so looking forward to a bit of normality. Take care Karen
Posts.Title: Need help with decision

Posts.Content: Happy New Year all Hi Croxley I had my expander implant replaced in November and have been offered for the other breast to be reduced and uplifted, all along I have said to my surgeon and family `why mess with it if it's not essential' but I am coming around to the idea of having it done.  I see a difference when dressed in photos etc although the family disagrees its obvious unless you look for it.  I think we have to go with how we feel so I see my surgeon in February and thinking to go ahead with the reduction.  Im finally going back to work this month after 21month's so looking forward to a bit of normality. Take care Karen
Posts.Title: Need help with decision

Posts.Content: Hi  Mr Basu at womens hospital (QE) is highly recommended as im sure the others are but he is my consultant so speak from experience. Good luck Karen
Posts.Title: Plastic surgeon Birmingham / West Midlands area

Posts.Content: Hi lou37, I had expander fitted in March 2015 it was inflated over a couple of days after healing from the operation and I was really happy with it however due to an infection during chemo it was decided to decrease it but its not really noticeable with clothes on.  It feels like a deflated balloon at the moment but am hoping it will be inflated again soon to prepare the skin for the permanent implant.  I would imagine recovery is the same with or without an impant at the same time. All the best for next week
Posts.Title: Prophylactic mastectomy with tissue expander and implants... Advice...
